plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: A classic autumn flowering plant widely cultivated in gardens for its large, colorful blooms. Chrysanthemums come in a variety of shapes and a spectrum of colors, offering vibrant displays as many other garden flowers fade.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide (native to East Asia)
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums symbolize longevity and rejuvenation in many cultures and are Japanâ€™s national flower.

plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: An evergreen shrub with showy, fragrant flowers commonly blooming in late summer to fall in Mediterranean and subtropical climates. Oleander flowers attract pollinators and can bloom in warm winters.
plants.location: Mediterranean Basin, Southern US, subtropical regions
plants.funFact: Despite its beauty, all parts of oleander are toxic if ingested.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: This evergreen shrub blooms in late autumn to early spring, producing elegant, rose-like flowers that brighten gardens during cooler months. The camelliaâ€™s glossy leaves remain vibrant year-round.
plants.location: East Asia, Southern US, parts of Europe
plants.funFact: Camellia japonica is the parent species of many hybrid camellias prized for their ornamental flowers.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: A native Australian tree that flowers from late autumn through spring, bearing cylindrical golden flower spikes rich in nectar, which support native birds and insects.
plants.funFact: Banksia flowers produce abundant nectar, historically used by Indigenous Australians as a sweet drink.
